discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Override enable will set the FortiGate2 as primary while is UP

Selected Answer: B
B is correct

Explanation: With override enabled, the primary unit with the highest device priority will always become the primary unit. Whenever an event occurs that may affect primary unit selection, the cluster negotiates. For example, when override is enabled a cluster renegotiates when you change the device priority of any cluster unit or when you add a new unit to a cluster.
Override and primary unit selection
Enabling override changes the order of primary unit selection. As shown below, if override is enabled, primary unit selection considers device priority before age and serial number. This means that if you set the device priority higher on one cluster unit, with override enabled this cluster unit becomes the primary unit even if its age and serial number are lower than other cluster units.
https://docs.fortinet.com/document/fortigate/6.0.0/handbook/123439/primary-unit-selection-with-override-enabled

Selected Answer: B
B correct
B is correct
B is correct
B. Page 415 of the Study Guide

choices.A: FGT-1 will remain the primary because FGT-2 has lower priority.
choices.B: FGT-2 will take over as the primary because it has the override enable setting and higher priority than FGT-1.
choices.C: FGT-1 will synchronize the override disable setting with FGT-2.
choices.D: The HA cluster will become out of sync because the override setting must match on all HA members.

A bit confusing, because match-vip is enabled by default after FortiOS 7.2.3 and these are 7.4 questions. So technically, we should assume it's already enabled which makes A an invalid answer. But since this question is copied from 7.2, A is still correct.

Selected Answer: AB
Page 64 Study Guide 7.4

choices.B: Set the Destination address as Webserver in the Deny policy.
choices.D: Set the Destination address as Deny_IP in the Allow_access policy.
choices.C: Disable match-vip in the Deny policy.
choices.A: Enable match-vip in the Deny policy.

choices.B: In flow-based inspection mode files bigger than the buffer size are scanned
choices.C: In proxy-based inspection mode files bigger than the buffer size are scanned
choices.D: In proxy-based inspection mode antivirus scanning buffers the whole file for scanning, before sending it to the client
choices.A: In flow-based inspection mode, FortiGate buffers the file, but also simultaneously transmits it to the client.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
If this is really an exam questions, it is really a question made to get you wrong... you must know the specific signature for facebook, to understand that it requires SSL deep inspection, otherwise, anyone could think that it would be another app signature which should be included.

Selected Answer: A
There is NO "reaction" app signature for facebook, "like button" is enough to leave reactions but it has a "lock" icon that does mean, "SSL deep inspection is required"

Selected Answer: A
The Facebook_Like.Button is selected. 
Facebook_Like.Button
ID 29210
Summary This indicates an attempt to "Like" a content that is shared on the Facebook servers.

Facebook Like is a feature that allows users to display their reaction to contents that are shared on the Facebook servers.

Deep inspection is required on this application signature. It is not on Video Play

Selected Answer: A
Rpta. A Pag.251

Selected Answer: A
A - Deep inspection is required for some apps, including this one. Refer to the old exam question where it is clearer.
https://www.examtopics.com/discussions/fortinet/view/92003-exam-nse4_fgt-70-topic-1-question-44-discussion/

Selected Answer: D
The issue appears to be with the application control profile settings in the security profile. Users can access and play videos but cannot leave reactions. This suggests that the application control profile lacks the required signatures to allow these actions. Therefore, the correct resolution would be:

D. Get the additional application signatures required to add to the security policy.

You would need to ensure the application signatures for actions like "Facebook_Reaction" or any related granular actions are included in the application control profile for Facebook.
A. In the previous version it was clearer, without deep inspection some functions are not available such as leaving reactions

Selected Answer: D
Α does not make sense. I would choose D.

comments.content: It makes sense if you know that specific application control settings as reactions, messager, videos and such require deep inspection, which the first screenshot shows is not enabled. I bet this is a "chose two" question in reality, and that D and A must be selected, because D is indeed correct, if full inspection is configured on the policy.

My guess is "D" therefore, but maybe this question and answers are not original to the real exam.

page 459-460

Conserver mode related behaviour.

Selected Answer: BC
B and C, conserve mode

Selected Answer: BC
B and C, conserve mode

Selected Answer: BC
Correct Answers:
B. FortiGate has entered conserve mode.
C. Administrators cannot change the configuration.

A: Incorrect. FortiSandbox behavior is unrelated to high memory usage.
B: Correct. Memory usage exceeded the red threshold (88%), triggering conserve mode.
C: Correct. Some configurations are restricted during conserve mode.
D: Incorrect. Console-only access happens at the extreme threshold (95%), which hasn’t been reached.

Selected Answer: BC
After the 88% set as "red", FortiGate sets in Conserve Mode, but you can yet access it by configured methods like Https or SSH if enabled

Selected Answer: BC
due to conserve mode don't allow to make changes.
B & C correct

Selected Answer: BC
Fortigate enter in conserve mode for that reason you cannot make changes.

Selected Answer: BC
Answer: B. and C.

It configured "set memory-use-threshold-red 88", so when memory comes up to 88% of usage and the memory consumption is 90%, so the FortiGate will enter in conserve mode. 
For this reason you can't change the configuration conserve mode don't allows.

Selected Answer: BC
B and C, conserve mode
Conserve mode . The answers are B and C

Fortigate does not accept configuration changes, because they might increase memory usage.
